experience.description: AI-first productivity platform automating 'Life Admin' workflows
experience.synopsis: Leading the end-to-end product lifecycle for an AI-first productivity platform that automates 'Life Admin' by converting unstructured emails, PDFs, and images into structured calendar events.
highlights: Architected a serverless, event-driven backend to automate complex 'Life Admin' workflows for consumers
Engineered a custom traffic router that dynamically directs payloads between low-latency text models and high-compute vision models, reducing processing overhead by ~40% and response times by ~70%
Solved temporal hallucination issues in LLMs by injecting dynamic context anchors and Chain-of-Thought protocols
Led the end-to-end product lifecycle from Zero-to-One, managing full stack & navigating App Store compliance

caseStudy.challenge: Users drown in 'Life Admin'—bills, appointments, event invites buried in emails. Manually copying dates to calendars is tedious and error-prone. The AI challenge: LLMs frequently 'hallucinated' dates, calculating relative dates from their training data cut-off instead of the current date.
caseStudy.solution: Engineered a 'Context Anchor' injection system that dynamically injects the current ISO timestamp and day of week at inference time. Built a 'Split-Path Engine' to route traffic between low-latency text models and high-compute vision models based on payload analysis. Implemented aggressive 'Junk Filters' to discard non-actionable attachments (<5KB signatures/icons).
caseStudy.impact: Completely solved the temporal hallucination issue. The 'Forward-to-Email' feature became the app's most-used ingress method. Reduced API costs by filtering 90% of junk attachments. Successfully launched on App Store within 8-week timeline.

experience.description: Central Monitoring Team - Serverless infrastructure & automation
experience.synopsis: Worked on the Central Monitoring Team building serverless infrastructure and automation for enterprise-scale OpenSearch deployments.
highlights: Designed and deployed a serverless API platform on AWS to manage large-scale OpenSearch permissions
Built event-driven workflows with EventBridge + Step Functions, mirroring stream-processing systems
Automated infrastructure provisioning with CloudFormation (IaC), reducing manual setup by 80%
Discovered and patched a security misconfiguration that also existed in Production—turned a deployment mistake into a security hardening win
Delivered features in a fully agile scrum team, contributing to sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives

caseStudy.challenge: The team manually processed ~10 tickets/day for user permissions in OpenSearch. The process was slow, error-prone, and created bottlenecks. Security misconfigurations could go unnoticed.
caseStudy.solution: Architected an EventBridge Pipe → Step Function workflow. Created CloudFormation templates for repeatable deployments. Built state machine logic to handle Add/Modify/Delete operations with full audit logging. Wrote comprehensive runbooks for operations.
caseStudy.impact: 80% reduction in manual work. Latency dropped from hours to near-instantaneous. Discovered and patched a security misconfiguration that also existed in Production—turned a deployment mistake into a security hardening win.

experience.description: Teaching machine learning and Python to engineering students
experience.synopsis: Tutoring and mentoring engineering students in machine learning, Python, and practical data science workflows.
highlights: Tutored 335+ students in machine learning and Python workflows for practical engineering use cases
Mentored students in applying AI/ML to real-world engineering datasets
Achieved 95% positive feedback from students across multiple semesters
Created inclusive classroom culture with 'no wrong questions' philosophy
Provided detailed feedback after quizzes, ensuring thorough understanding

caseStudy.challenge: Engineering students often struggle with the transition from theoretical concepts to practical machine learning implementation. Many feel intimidated by coding and hesitant to ask questions.
caseStudy.solution: Established a 'no wrong questions' classroom culture. Provided proactive check-ins and email support for project milestones. Gave detailed quiz feedback focusing on understanding rather than just marks. Encouraged peer collaboration and group work.
caseStudy.impact: 95% positive anonymous feedback. Students reported feeling confident to apply ML concepts to their engineering projects. Many students continued to reach out for advice even after the course ended.

leadership.description: Led Australia's largest university robotics club
leadership.synopsis: Grew from Workshop Coordinator to President of Australia's largest university robotics club, scaling from 230 to 1,800+ members.
highlights: Directed a 25-member engineering team delivering 30+ events
Scaled operations from 230 to 1,800+ members in 2 years
Led a team of 5 to teach introductory robotics to 70+ students every week
Developed Arduino, OpenCV (Python) and X-Y Plotter learning modules for university students of all disciplines
Delivered cross-disciplinary workshops on programming, computer vision, and embedded systems
Secured 10+ industry partners and acted as key liaison between technical teams and stakeholders
The only member of the team with no prior robotics experience / not studying mechatronics

caseStudy.challenge: The club had potential but lacked structure for sustainable growth. An early crisis occurred when 1,100 people signed up for a 60-person event due to an uncapped ticket release error.
caseStudy.solution: Immediately halted sales, convened a crisis meeting, and pivoted to a 4-day repeated event format (340 total attendees). Led transparent communication. Shifted culture from 'Growth at all costs' to 'Better, not bigger'—prioritizing team sustainability. Managed end-to-end grant acquittals and created flawless financial ledgers.
caseStudy.impact: The new tickets sold out in 3 minutes. Scaled from 230 to 1,800+ members over 2 years. Secured 10+ industry partners including major tech companies. Learned critical lessons about team sustainability and crisis management.

leadership.description: Promoting Engineering as an exciting career to K-12 students
leadership.synopsis: Delivered hands-on STEM workshops to Years 5-12 students, promoting Engineering as an exciting career option with emphasis on Sustainable and Humanitarian Engineering.
highlights: Delivered 100+ hours of thematic learning modules & conducted creative, hands-on workshops with students of Years 5-12
Promoted Engineering as an exciting career option, with special emphasis on Sustainable and Humanitarian Engineering
Regularly tasked with helping new volunteers get up to speed with our common aim of sharing our passion for Engineering

caseStudy.challenge: Many students have limited exposure to engineering concepts and don't see it as a viable career path, especially in underrepresented communities.
caseStudy.solution: Designed and delivered hands-on workshops that made engineering tangible and fun. Focused on sustainable and humanitarian applications to show the positive impact engineers can have on the world.
caseStudy.impact: Helped inspire students to consider engineering as a career path. Mentored new volunteers to maintain quality of workshop delivery.

variousRoles.description: Coordinating workshops and program events between students, staff and partners
variousRoles.synopsis: Liaising between students, academic staff, and external partners to coordinate workshops and program events for the Faculty of Engineering.
highlights: Liaising between students, academic staff & external partners to coordinate workshops and program events
Managing communications, schedules & resources, producing briefings & slide decks for diverse audiences
Driving continuous improvement through participant feedback & translating it into practical program changes
Standardising templates (agendas, comms, checklists) so programs can be repeated reliably by other staff
Troubleshooting last-minute issues calmly (tech, room, logistics) to keep events running to time

caseStudy.challenge: Faculty programs involve coordination across multiple stakeholders with different priorities and communication styles.
caseStudy.solution: Created standardized templates and checklists for program delivery. Established clear communication channels between all parties. Built in feedback loops for continuous improvement.
caseStudy.impact: Programs run more smoothly with less last-minute chaos. Templates now used by other staff members for their events.

variousRoles.description: Event staff for multiple brand activations
variousRoles.synopsis: Worked casually as event staff for multiple brand activations, creating positive brand experiences for attendees.
highlights: Worked casually as event staff for multiple events
Responsible for engaging with consumers and creating a positive brand experience for attendees
Ensured smooth operations and the overall success of each event

caseStudy.challenge: Brand activations require quick thinking and adaptability to create memorable experiences for diverse audiences.
caseStudy.solution: Engaged authentically with attendees, adapted to different brand requirements, and ensured smooth event operations.
caseStudy.impact: Successfully represented multiple brands at various events across Sydney.

variousRoles.description: Teaching robotics to Year 8 students at Reddam House School
variousRoles.synopsis: Delivered the Line Follower & Light Crawler Robot activities as part of the CASE FlipRobot Academy curriculum to Year 8 students.
highlights: Delivered Line Follower & Light Crawler Robot activities to Year 8 students at Reddam House School, Sydney
Part of the CASE FlipRobot Academy curriculum
Teaching robotics fundamentals and Arduino programming

caseStudy.challenge: Engaging young students with complex robotics concepts in an accessible and fun way.
caseStudy.solution: Used hands-on activities with FlipRobot kits to make learning tangible. Built projects step-by-step with clear explanations.
caseStudy.impact: Students successfully built and programmed their own robots by the end of the course.
